description: Common argument domains, categorized by resolvability and typical failure modes

categories.name: Life Decisions
categories.description: High-stakes personal choices. Often context-dependent—right answer varies by situation.

domains.name: Rent vs Buy
domains.typical_framing: Renting is throwing money away vs buying is a trap
domains.why_it_persists: Depends heavily on: location, career stability, interest rates, opportunity cost, lifestyle preferences. People argue from their own context as if universal.
domains.path_to_resolution: Acknowledge it's a math problem with personal inputs. Run the numbers for your specific situation.

domains.name: Public vs Private School
domains.typical_framing: Private schools are worth any cost vs public schools are fine
domains.why_it_persists: Conflates multiple factors: academic outcomes, social environment, values transmission, network effects. Also class signaling.
domains.path_to_resolution: Evaluate specific schools, not categories. Define what outcomes you're optimizing for.

domains.name: City vs Suburb vs Rural
domains.typical_framing: Cities are vibrant vs suburbs are soulless vs rural is isolated
domains.why_it_persists: Different life stages, careers, and personalities genuinely benefit from different environments.
domains.path_to_resolution: List your actual priorities. Visit and try places. Recognize it can change over time.

domains.name: Is College Worth It?
domains.typical_framing: Degree required for success vs college is a scam
domains.why_it_persists: Highly field-dependent. Also conflates signaling value, learning value, and network value.
domains.path_to_resolution: Depends entirely on field and specific school. Compare concrete alternatives.

domains.name: Having Children
domains.typical_framing: Kids give life meaning vs kids ruin your life
domains.why_it_persists: Genuinely different values. Also: parents can't unknow parenthood, non-parents can't know it.
domains.path_to_resolution: Pure values question. Neither side can prove the other wrong. Respect the difference.

categories.name: Financial & Investment
categories.description: Money debates. Often have right answers that depend on time horizon and risk tolerance.

domains.name: Active vs Passive Investing
domains.typical_framing: Beat the market vs just buy index funds
domains.why_it_persists: Survivorship bias in active success stories. Also: some people enjoy the game.
domains.path_to_resolution: Data strongly favors passive for most people. Active can work but most who think they can, can't.

domains.name: Cryptocurrency Investment
domains.typical_framing: Future of money vs greater fool scam
domains.why_it_persists: Combines technology speculation, monetary theory, and tribal identity. High emotional stakes from gains/losses.
domains.path_to_resolution: Separate technology assessment from investment thesis. Size positions to risk tolerance.

domains.name: Market Timing
domains.typical_framing: Wait for the dip vs time in market beats timing
domains.why_it_persists: Feels like it should work. Hindsight makes past timing look obvious.
domains.path_to_resolution: Empirically resolved: time in market wins for almost everyone. But people keep trying.

categories.name: Technology Choices
categories.description: Tool and platform debates. Often tribal identity masquerading as technical discussion.

domains.name: Mac vs Windows vs Linux
domains.typical_framing: Mac just works vs Windows is standard vs Linux is freedom
domains.why_it_persists: Genuine tradeoffs exist, but identity attachment exceeds technical differences.
domains.path_to_resolution: All three work fine. Pick based on your actual needs and software requirements.

domains.name: Programming Language X vs Y
domains.typical_framing: My language is better vs your language is trash
domains.why_it_persists: Familiarity breeds preference. Also: genuine tradeoffs that matter in specific contexts.
domains.path_to_resolution: Context-dependent. Most languages are fine for most things. Optimize for team and ecosystem.

domains.name: Tabs vs Spaces
domains.typical_framing: Tabs are semantic vs spaces are precise
domains.why_it_persists: Low stakes + strong opinions = eternal flame war. Also accessibility arguments (tabs) vs alignment arguments (spaces).
domains.path_to_resolution: Pick one per project and enforce with tooling. The debate is not worth the time.

domains.name: Will AI Replace X?
domains.typical_framing: AI will take all jobs vs AI is just hype
domains.why_it_persists: Uncertainty about the future + motivated reasoning (fear or hope) + rapid change.
domains.path_to_resolution: Break down into specific tasks, not whole jobs. Short-term overestimated, long-term underestimated.

domains.name: Monolith vs Microservices
domains.typical_framing: Microservices scale vs monoliths are simpler
domains.why_it_persists: Resume-driven development. Also genuine tradeoffs that depend on team size and scale.
domains.path_to_resolution: Start monolith, extract services when you have clear boundaries and genuine need.

categories.name: Political & Policy
categories.description: Value-laden debates where people optimize for different things. Often unresolvable because the disagreement is about goals, not facts.

domains.name: Democrat vs Republican
domains.typical_framing: Other side is evil/stupid vs my side is reasonable
domains.why_it_persists: Package deal identities. Disagreements about values masquerading as disagreements about facts.
hidden_variables: value weights (liberty vs equality vs security)
domains.path_to_resolution: Separate factual claims (testable) from value claims (not). Most productive: understand what the other side is optimizing for.

domains.name: Abortion Rights
domains.typical_framing: Bodily autonomy vs right to life
domains.why_it_persists: Genuinely different foundational values about personhood, rights hierarchy, and state role.
hidden_variables: role of state in personal decisions
domains.path_to_resolution: Likely unresolvable at society level. Core disagreement is philosophical, not empirical.

domains.name: Gun Control
domains.typical_framing: Guns kill people vs guns protect people
domains.why_it_persists: Mixes empirical claims (what policies reduce harm) with value claims (rights vs safety tradeoffs).
hidden_variables: weight of self-defense vs collective safety
domains.path_to_resolution: Isolate empirical questions (what works) from value questions (what tradeoffs are acceptable).

domains.name: Climate Policy
domains.typical_framing: Existential crisis vs economic alarmism
domains.why_it_persists: Mixes science (what's happening) with economics (costs of action) with values (intergenerational obligations).
domains.path_to_resolution: Separate: (1) Is it happening? (2) How bad? (3) What to do? Most disagreement is on 3, disguised as disagreement on 1.

categories.name: Internet Classics
categories.description: Tribal markers and pure preferences that get argued like they have objective answers.

domains.name: iOS vs Android
domains.typical_framing: Apple sheep vs Android fragmentation
domains.why_it_persists: Sunk cost (ecosystem), identity attachment, genuine but minor tradeoffs.
domains.path_to_resolution: Both are fine. Pick based on ecosystem and budget. Stop arguing.

domains.name: PlayStation vs Xbox vs Nintendo vs PC
domains.typical_framing: My platform is superior
domains.why_it_persists: Sunk cost justification. Tribal identity. Children arguing, adults continuing.
domains.path_to_resolution: Buy what has the games you want. The argument is identity, not utility.

domains.name: Star Wars vs Star Trek
domains.typical_framing: Space fantasy vs space philosophy
domains.why_it_persists: They're different genres. Comparing them is category error.
domains.path_to_resolution: Like both or either. They're not competing for the same niche.

domains.name: Pineapple on Pizza
domains.typical_framing: Delicious vs abomination
domains.why_it_persists: Pure preference treated as moral stance. Performative outrage is fun.
domains.path_to_resolution: Taste is subjective. There is no argument here. Eat what you like.

domains.name: Is a Hot Dog a Sandwich?
domains.typical_framing: Definitional debate
domains.why_it_persists: Category boundaries are fuzzy. No authority to decree definitions.
domains.path_to_resolution: Definitions are tools, not truths. Define terms for your context and move on.

domains.name: Vim vs Emacs
domains.typical_framing: Modal editing vs Lisp machine
domains.why_it_persists: Investment in learning creates attachment. Both are powerful.
domains.path_to_resolution: Use what you're productive in. VS Code won anyway.

categories.name: Parenting Choices
categories.description: High emotional stakes + asymmetric information (only parents of that type know their experience). Judgment-heavy.

domains.name: Kids and Screen Time
domains.typical_framing: Screens are poison vs screens are fine
domains.why_it_persists: Research is mixed. Parents defending their choices. Guilt and judgment.
domains.path_to_resolution: Nuance: content and context matter more than raw time. Research is evolving.

domains.name: Breastfeeding Duration
domains.typical_framing: Breast is best vs fed is best
domains.why_it_persists: Identity, guilt, judgment. Benefits real but overstated in discourse.
domains.path_to_resolution: Benefits exist but are modest. Support mothers' choices without judgment.

domains.name: Discipline Approaches
domains.typical_framing: Gentle parenting vs kids need boundaries
domains.why_it_persists: Different values (autonomy vs structure). Also: people confuse approaches with implementations.
domains.path_to_resolution: Most approaches work when applied consistently with love. Extremes fail.

categories.name: Health & Lifestyle
categories.description: Personal experience weighted heavily. Science often unclear or evolving. Strong identity components.

domains.name: Diet Wars (Keto vs Vegan vs Carnivore vs...)
domains.typical_framing: My diet is optimal vs your diet is harmful
domains.why_it_persists: Individual variation is real. Confirmation bias from personal results. Identity attachment.
domains.path_to_resolution: Most diets work for weight loss if followed. Long-term health is less clear. Individual variation matters.

domains.name: Exercise Modalities
domains.typical_framing: Cardio vs lifting vs HIIT vs yoga
domains.why_it_persists: All work. People defend their investment. Fitness influencer economy.
domains.path_to_resolution: Best exercise is one you'll do consistently. Mix modalities for overall health.

domains.name: Work-Life Balance / Hustle Culture
domains.typical_framing: Grind to succeed vs work to live
domains.why_it_persists: Different values. Survivorship bias from successful grinders. Also: circumstances differ wildly.
domains.path_to_resolution: Depends on goals, stage, and values. Neither extreme is universally right.

unresolvable_patterns.description: Why certain arguments never reach resolution

patterns.name: Pure Preference
patterns.description: No objective answer exists—it's just taste.
patterns.signal: Argument uses 'better' or 'worse' for subjective experiences
patterns.resolution: Acknowledge subjectivity. 'I prefer X' not 'X is better.'

patterns.name: Values-Based
patterns.description: Disagreement is about what to optimize for, not facts.
patterns.signal: Both sides have internally consistent logic but different premises
patterns.resolution: Surface the value difference. You likely won't resolve it but can understand it.

patterns.name: Context-Dependent
patterns.description: Right answer varies by situation, but people argue as if universal.
patterns.signal: Answer starts with 'it depends' but argument ignores that
patterns.resolution: Identify the variables. Run analysis for specific situation.

patterns.name: Unfalsifiable
patterns.description: Claims cannot be tested or proven wrong in principle.
patterns.signal: No conceivable evidence would change either side's mind
patterns.resolution: Acknowledge the epistemic limits. May not be worth arguing.

patterns.name: Identity/Tribal
patterns.description: Position is group membership marker, not truth-seeking.
patterns.signal: Defending position feels like defending self. Attacks feel personal.
patterns.resolution: Recognize when you're defending identity vs seeking truth. Disengage or reframe.

patterns.name: Asymmetric Information
patterns.description: People arguing from genuinely different experiences that can't be shared.
patterns.signal: One side says 'you can't understand unless you've experienced it'
patterns.resolution: Acknowledge experiential gaps. Listen more, argue less.
